- **PostToolUse**: ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«å®Ÿè¡Œå¾Œã®è‡ªå‹•å‡¦ç†ãƒ»æ¤œè¨¼
- **Notification**: é€šçŸ¥ã‚«ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒã‚¤ã‚º
- **Stop**: å¿œç­”çµ‚äº†æ™‚ã®ç¶™ç¶šåˆ¶å¾¡

```diff

+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ ğŸ›¡ï¸ Claude Code Rule Enforcer
+ PreToolUse hook: ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç·¨é›†æ™‚ã®ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«å¼·åˆ¶ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ 
+ """
+ 
+ import json
+ import sys
+ import os
+ import re
+ from pathlib import Path
+ from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional
+ 
+ class RuleEnforcer:
+     def __init__(self):
+         self.project_root = Path.cwd()
+         self.rules_dir = self.project_root / ".cursor" / "rules"
+         self.config_file = self.project_root / ".claude" / "rule-config.json"
+         self.load_rules()
+     
+     def load_rules(self):
+         """é–‹ç™ºãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã¿"""
+         self.rules = {
+             "forbidden_patterns": [
+                 r"console\.log\(",  # ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚½ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãƒ­ã‚°ç¦æ­¢
+                 r"debugger;",       # ãƒ‡ãƒãƒƒã‚¬ãƒ¼ç¦æ­¢
+                 r"alert\(",         # ã‚¢ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒˆç¦æ­¢
+                 r"TODO:",           # TODOç¦æ­¢ï¼ˆä½œæ¥­è¨˜éŒ²ä½¿ç”¨ï¼‰
+                 r"FIXME:",          # FIXMEç¦æ­¢ï¼ˆä½œæ¥­è¨˜éŒ²ä½¿ç”¨ï¼‰
+             ],
+             "required_patterns": {
+                 "*.py": [
+                     r"#!/usr/bin/env python3",  # Pythonãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®shebangå¿…é ˆ
+                     r"\"\"\".*\"\"\"",          # docstringå¿…é ˆ
+                 ],
+                 "*.js": [
+                     r"'use strict';",           # strict modeå¿…é ˆ
+                 ],
+                 "*.md": [
+                     r"^# ",                     # h1ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒˆãƒ«å¿…é ˆ
+                 ]
+             },
+             "protected_files": [
+                 "ai-agents/manage.sh",
+                 ".claude/settings.json",
+                 ".cursor/rules/",
+                 "logs/work-records.md"
+             ],
+             "mandatory_format": {
+                 "*.py": "black",
+                 "*.js": "prettier",
+                 "*.md": "markdownlint"
+             }
+         }
+     
+     def validate_file_operation(self, tool_input: Dict[str, Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œã®æ¤œè¨¼"""
+         file_path = tool_input.get("file_path", "")
+         content = tool_input.get("content", "")
+         
+         # ä¿è­·ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+         if self.is_protected_file(file_path):
+             return {
+                 "decision": "block",
+                 "reason": f"ğŸš« ä¿è­·ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«: {file_path}\né‡è¦ãªã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãŸã‚ç·¨é›†ã‚’åˆ¶é™ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚"
+             }
+         
+         # ç¦æ­¢ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+         forbidden_issues = self.check_forbidden_patterns(content)
+         if forbidden_issues:
+             return {
+                 "decision": "block", 
+                 "reason": f"ğŸš« ç¦æ­¢ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³æ¤œå‡º:\n" + "\n".join(f"â€¢ {issue}" for issue in forbidden_issues)
+             }
+         
+         # å¿…é ˆãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+         required_issues = self.check_required_patterns(file_path, content)
+         if required_issues:
+             return {
+                 "decision": "block",
+                 "reason": f"âš ï¸ å¿…é ˆãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ä¸è¶³:\n" + "\n".join(f"â€¢ {issue}" for issue in required_issues)
+             }
+         
+         # æ‰¿èª
+         return {
+             "decision": "approve",
+             "reason": "âœ… ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯é€šé"
+         }
+     
+     def is_protected_file(self, file_path: str) -> bool:
+         """ä¿è­·ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"""
+         for protected in self.rules["protected_files"]:
+             if protected in file_path or file_path.startswith(protected):
+                 return True
+         return False
+     
+     def check_forbidden_patterns(self, content: str) -> List[str]:
+         """ç¦æ­¢ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"""
+         issues = []
+         for pattern in self.rules["forbidden_patterns"]:
+             if re.search(pattern, content):
+                 issues.append(f"ç¦æ­¢ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³: {pattern}")
+         return issues
+     
+     def check_required_patterns(self, file_path: str, content: str) -> List[str]:
+         """å¿…é ˆãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"""
+         issues = []
+         for pattern_glob, patterns in self.rules["required_patterns"].items():
+             if self.matches_glob(file_path, pattern_glob):
+                 for pattern in patterns:
+                     if not re.search(pattern, content):
+                         issues.append(f"å¿…é ˆãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ä¸è¶³: {pattern}")
+         return issues
+     
+     def matches_glob(self, file_path: str, pattern: str) -> bool:
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ãƒãƒƒãƒãƒ³ã‚°"""
+         if pattern.startswith("*."):
+             ext = pattern[2:]
+             return file_path.endswith(f".{ext}")
+         return pattern in file_path
+     
+     def log_enforcement_action(self, action: str, file_path: str, reason: str):
+         """ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«å¼·åˆ¶ã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®ãƒ­ã‚°è¨˜éŒ²"""
+         log_file = self.project_root / "logs" / "rule-enforcement.log"
+         log_file.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+         
+         from datetime import datetime
+         timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
+         
+         log_entry = f"[{timestamp}] {action}: {file_path} - {reason}\n"
+         with open(log_file, "a") as f:
+             f.write(log_entry)
+ 
+ def main():
+     try:
+         # æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰JSONå–å¾—
+         input_data = json.load(sys.stdin)
+         
+         enforcer = RuleEnforcer()
+         
+         # ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«æƒ…å ±å–å¾—
+         tool_name = input_data.get("tool_name", "")
+         tool_input = input_data.get("tool_input", {})
+         
+         # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œã®ã¿å¯¾è±¡
+         if tool_name in ["Edit", "Write", "MultiEdit"]:
+             result = enforcer.validate_file_operation(tool_input)
+             
+             # ãƒ­ã‚°è¨˜éŒ²
+             file_path = tool_input.get("file_path", "unknown")
+             enforcer.log_enforcement_action(
+                 result["decision"], 
+                 file_path, 
+                 result["reason"]
+             )
+             
+             # çµæœå‡ºåŠ›
+             print(json.dumps(result, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2))
+             
+             # æ‹’å¦ã®å ´åˆã¯ exit code 2
+             if result["decision"] == "block":
+                 sys.exit(2)
+         
+         # æ‰¿èª
+         sys.exit(0)
+         
+     except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
+         print(f"JSONè§£æã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+     except Exception as e:
+         print(f"ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ã‚µãƒ¼ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main() 
```

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>excellent! æœ€åˆã®hookã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’ä½œæˆã—ãŸã€‚ä¸¦åˆ—å®Ÿè¡Œã®ãŸã‚ã€ä»–ã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚‚åŒæ™‚ã«ä½œæˆã—ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã€‚è¤‡æ•°ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’åŒæ™‚ã«ä½œæˆã™ã‚‹ã€‚</details></think>

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ âœ¨ Claude Code Auto Formatter
+ PostToolUse hook: ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ç·¨é›†å¾Œã®è‡ªå‹•ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ»æœ€é©åŒ–
+ """
+ 
+ import json
+ import sys
+ import os
+ import subprocess
+ from pathlib import Path
+ from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional
+ 
+ class AutoFormatter:
+     def __init__(self):
+         self.project_root = Path.cwd()
+         self.formatters = {
+             ".py": self.format_python,
+             ".js": self.format_javascript,
+             ".ts": self.format_typescript,
+             ".md": self.format_markdown,
+             ".json": self.format_json,
+             ".sh": self.format_shell,
+         }
+     
+     def format_file(self, file_path: str) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®è‡ªå‹•ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         path = Path(file_path)
+         
+         if not path.exists():
+             return {"success": False, "message": f"ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒå­˜åœ¨ã—ã¾ã›ã‚“: {file_path}"}
+         
+         # æ‹¡å¼µå­ã«åŸºã¥ããƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
+         ext = path.suffix.lower()
+         if ext in self.formatters:
+             return self.formatters[ext](path)
+         
+         return {"success": True, "message": f"ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå¯¾è±¡å¤–: {ext}"}
+     
+     def format_python(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """Pythonãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         results = []
+         
+         # Black ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
+         try:
+             result = subprocess.run(
+                 ["black", "--quiet", str(path)],
+                 capture_output=True,
+                 text=True,
+                 timeout=30
+             )
+             if result.returncode == 0:
+                 results.append("âœ… Black ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Œäº†")
+             else:
+                 results.append(f"âš ï¸ Black ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {result.stderr}")
+         except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+             results.append("âš ï¸ Black ãŒåˆ©ç”¨ã§ãã¾ã›ã‚“")
+         
+         # isort ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆæ•´ç†
+         try:
+             result = subprocess.run(
+                 ["isort", "--quiet", str(path)],
+                 capture_output=True,
+                 text=True,
+                 timeout=30
+             )
+             if result.returncode == 0:
+                 results.append("âœ… isort ã‚¤ãƒ³ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆæ•´ç†å®Œäº†")
+         except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+             results.append("âš ï¸ isort ãŒåˆ©ç”¨ã§ãã¾ã›ã‚“")
+         
+         return {"success": True, "message": "\n".join(results)}
+     
+     def format_javascript(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """JavaScriptãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         try:
+             result = subprocess.run(
+                 ["prettier", "--write", str(path)],
+                 capture_output=True,
+                 text=True,
+                 timeout=30
+             )
+             if result.returncode == 0:
+                 return {"success": True, "message": "âœ… Prettier ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Œäº†"}
+             else:
+                 return {"success": False, "message": f"âš ï¸ Prettier ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {result.stderr}"}
+         except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+             return {"success": False, "message": "âš ï¸ Prettier ãŒåˆ©ç”¨ã§ãã¾ã›ã‚“"}
+     
+     def format_typescript(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """TypeScriptãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         return self.format_javascript(path)  # åŒã˜ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒã‚¿ãƒ¼ä½¿ç”¨
+     
+     def format_markdown(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """Markdownãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         results = []
+         
+         # prettier ã§ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
+         try:
+             result = subprocess.run(
+                 ["prettier", "--write", "--parser", "markdown", str(path)],
+                 capture_output=True,
+                 text=True,
+                 timeout=30
+             )
+             if result.returncode == 0:
+                 results.append("âœ… Prettier Markdown ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Œäº†")
+             else:
+                 results.append(f"âš ï¸ Prettier ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {result.stderr}")
+         except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+             results.append("âš ï¸ Prettier ãŒåˆ©ç”¨ã§ãã¾ã›ã‚“")
+         
+         # ç›®æ¬¡ã®è‡ªå‹•ç”Ÿæˆï¼ˆ# ã§å§‹ã¾ã‚‹è¡Œã®ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼‰
+         try:
+             with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+             
+             if '## ç›®æ¬¡' not in content and content.count('\n# ') > 3:
+                 results.append("ğŸ’¡ ç›®æ¬¡ã®è‡ªå‹•ç”Ÿæˆã‚’æ¨å¥¨ã—ã¾ã™")
+         except Exception:
+             pass
+         
+         return {"success": True, "message": "\n".join(results)}
+     
+     def format_json(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         try:
+             with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 data = json.load(f)
+             
+             with open(path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 json.dump(data, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2)
+             
+             return {"success": True, "message": "âœ… JSON ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Œäº†"}
+         except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
+             return {"success": False, "message": f"âš ï¸ JSON æ§‹æ–‡ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}"}
+         except Exception as e:
+             return {"success": False, "message": f"âš ï¸ JSON ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}"}
+     
+     def format_shell(self, path: Path) -> Dict[str, Any]:
+         """ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã®ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ"""
+         try:
+             # shfmt ã§ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ
+             result = subprocess.run(
+                 ["shfmt", "-w", "-i", "4", str(path)],
+                 capture_output=True,
+                 text=True,
+                 timeout=30
+             )
+             if result.returncode == 0:
+                 return {"success": True, "message": "âœ… shfmt ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Œäº†"}
+             else:
+                 return {"success": False, "message": f"âš ï¸ shfmt ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {result.stderr}"}
+         except (subprocess.TimeoutExpired, FileNotFoundError):
+             # æ‰‹å‹•ã§åŸºæœ¬çš„ãªæ•´å½¢
+             try:
+                 with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                     content = f.read()
+                 
+                 # å®Ÿè¡Œæ¨©é™ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ãƒ»è¿½åŠ 
+                 if not os.access(path, os.X_OK):
+                     os.chmod(path, 0o755)
+                     return {"success": True, "message": "âœ… å®Ÿè¡Œæ¨©é™ã‚’ä»˜ä¸ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ"}
+                 
+                 return {"success": True, "message": "âœ… ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆç¢ºèªå®Œäº†"}
+             except Exception as e:
+                 return {"success": False, "message": f"âš ï¸ ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}"}
+     
+     def add_file_headers(self, path: Path) -> None:
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼ã®è‡ªå‹•è¿½åŠ """
+         ext = path.suffix.lower()
+         
+         try:
+             with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+             
+             header_added = False
+             
+             # Pythonãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼
+             if ext == '.py' and not content.startswith('#!/usr/bin/env python3'):
+                 content = '#!/usr/bin/env python3\n"""\nãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«èª¬æ˜ã‚’ã“ã“ã«è¨˜è¿°\n"""\n\n' + content
+                 header_added = True
+             
+             # ã‚·ã‚§ãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã®ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼
+             elif ext == '.sh' and not content.startswith('#!/bin/bash'):
+                 content = '#!/bin/bash\n# ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆèª¬æ˜ã‚’ã“ã“ã«è¨˜è¿°\n\n' + content
+                 header_added = True
+             
+             if header_added:
+                 with open(path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                     f.write(content)
+         except Exception:
+             pass  # ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼è¿½åŠ ã¯å¿…é ˆã§ã¯ãªã„
+     
+     def log_format_action(self, file_path: str, result: Dict[str, Any]):
+         """ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆã‚¢ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã®ãƒ­ã‚°è¨˜éŒ²"""
+         log_file = self.project_root / "logs" / "auto-format.log"
+         log_file.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+         
+         from datetime import datetime
+         timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
+         
+         log_entry = f"[{timestamp}] {file_path}: {result['message']}\n"
+         with open(log_file, "a") as f:
+             f.write(log_entry)
+ 
+ def main():
+     try:
+         # æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰JSONå–å¾—
+         input_data = json.load(sys.stdin)
+         
+         formatter = AutoFormatter()
+         
+         # ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«æƒ…å ±å–å¾—
+         tool_name = input_data.get("tool_name", "")
+         tool_input = input_data.get("tool_input", {})
+         
+         # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œå¾Œã®å‡¦ç†
+         if tool_name in ["Edit", "Write", "MultiEdit"]:
+             file_path = tool_input.get("file_path", "")
+             
+             if file_path:
+                 # è‡ªå‹•ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆå®Ÿè¡Œ
+                 result = formatter.format_file(file_path)
+                 
+                 # ãƒ˜ãƒƒãƒ€ãƒ¼è¿½åŠ 
+                 path = Path(file_path)
+                 if path.exists():
+                     formatter.add_file_headers(path)
+                 
+                 # ãƒ­ã‚°è¨˜éŒ²
+                 formatter.log_format_action(file_path, result)
+                 
+                 # çµæœå‡ºåŠ›ï¼ˆãƒ¦ãƒ¼ã‚¶ãƒ¼ã«è¡¨ç¤ºã•ã‚Œã‚‹ï¼‰
+                 print(f"ğŸ¨ è‡ªå‹•ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆ: {file_path}")
+                 print(result['message'])
+         
+         sys.exit(0)
+         
+     except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
+         print(f"JSONè§£æã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+     except Exception as e:
+         print(f"è‡ªå‹•ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒã‚¿ãƒ¼ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main() 
```

+     local message="$2"

+     echo "[$timestamp] [$level] $message" >> "$LOG_FILE"

+   "decision": "block",
+   "reason": "ğŸš« å±é™ºãªã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒæ¤œå‡ºã•ã‚Œã¾ã—ãŸ\\n\\næ¤œå‡ºãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³: $pattern\\n\\nã“ã®ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã¯ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ å®‰å…¨æ€§ã®ãŸã‚å®Ÿè¡Œã‚’åˆ¶é™ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚\\nåˆ¥ã®ã‚¢ãƒ—ãƒ­ãƒ¼ãƒã‚’æ¤œè¨ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚"

+ # ä¿è­·ãƒ‘ã‚¹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+ check_protected_paths() {
+     local command="$1"

+   "reason": "ğŸš« ä¿è­·ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ‘ã‚¹ãƒ»ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¸ã®æ“ä½œ\\n\\nãƒ‘ã‚¹: $path\\n\\né‡è¦ãªã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ãŸã‚æ“ä½œã‚’åˆ¶é™ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚"

+ # æ¨å¥¨æ”¹å–„ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+ check_command_improvements() {
+     local command="$1"
+     local suggestions=()
+     
+     # grep â†’ rg æ¨å¥¨
+     if echo "$command" | grep -q "grep" && ! echo "$command" | grep -q "rg"; then

+     fi
+     
+     # find â†’ rg --files æ¨å¥¨
+     if echo "$command" | grep -q "find.*-name"; then

+     fi

+     # ls â†’ exa æ¨å¥¨

+         suggestions+=("ğŸ’¡ 'ls' ã®ä»£ã‚ã‚Šã« 'exa' ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨")
+     fi
+     
+     # cat â†’ bat æ¨å¥¨
+     if echo "$command" | grep -q "^cat " && ! echo "$command" | grep -q "bat"; then
+         suggestions+=("ğŸ’¡ 'cat' ã®ä»£ã‚ã‚Šã« 'bat' ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨")
+     fi

+ {

+ }

+         exit 0
+     fi
+ }

+ check_ai_system_commands() {

+ {
+   "decision": "approve",

+   "reason": "âœ… Claude Codeé–¢é€£ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰"

+ # ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚¸ã‚§ã‚¯ãƒˆå›ºæœ‰ã®åˆ¶é™
+ check_project_rules() {
+     local command="$1"
+     
+     # manage.sh ã®ç›´æ¥ç·¨é›†ã‚’åˆ¶é™
+     if echo "$command" | grep -q "ai-agents/manage.sh" && echo "$command" | grep -q -E "(sed|awk|perl|vim|nano|edit)"; then
+         log_validation "BLOCK" "manage.sh ç›´æ¥ç·¨é›†åˆ¶é™"
+         cat << EOF
+ {
+   "decision": "block",
+   "reason": "ğŸš« ai-agents/manage.sh ã®ç›´æ¥ç·¨é›†ã¯åˆ¶é™ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™\\n\\nä»£ã‚ã‚Šã« git ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ã¦é©åˆ‡ã«ãƒãƒƒã‚¯ã‚¢ãƒƒãƒ—ãƒ»å¾©æ—§ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚"
+ }
+ EOF
+         exit 2
+     fi
+     
+     # .cursor/rules ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å‰Šé™¤åˆ¶é™
+     if echo "$command" | grep -q ".cursor/rules" && echo "$command" | grep -q "rm"; then
+         log_validation "BLOCK" "Cursor ruleså‰Šé™¤åˆ¶é™"
+         cat << EOF
+ {
+   "decision": "block",
+   "reason": "ğŸš« .cursor/rules ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã®å‰Šé™¤ã¯åˆ¶é™ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™\\n\\né–‹ç™ºãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¯ä¿è­·ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚"
+ }
+ EOF
+         exit 2
+     fi
+ }
+ 
+ # ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³å‡¦ç†
+ main() {
+     # æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰JSONèª­ã¿å–ã‚Š
+     if ! input_json=$(cat); then
+         log_validation "ERROR" "JSONå…¥åŠ›èª­ã¿å–ã‚Šã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼"
+         echo "JSONèª­ã¿å–ã‚Šã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼" >&2

+     # jqã§ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰æŠ½å‡º

+         echo "ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰æŠ½å‡ºã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼" >&2
+         exit 1
+     fi
+     
+     # ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ãŒç©ºã®å ´åˆã¯æ‰¿èª
+     if [ -z "$command" ]; then

+     log_validation "CHECK" "ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰æ¤œè¨¼é–‹å§‹: $command"

+   "decision": "approve",
+   "reason": "âœ… ã‚»ã‚­ãƒ¥ãƒªãƒ†ã‚£ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯é€šé"

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>command-validator.sh ã‚‚ä½œæˆã—ãŸã€‚æ®‹ã‚Šã®2ã¤ã®ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚‚ä¸¦åˆ—ã§ä½œæˆã—ã¦ã„ã“ã†ã€‚</details></think>

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ """
+ ğŸ§  Claude Code Learning Tracker  
+ PostToolUse hook: AI ã®å‹•ä½œãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³å­¦ç¿’ãƒ»åˆ†æãƒ»æ”¹å–„ææ¡ˆ
+ """
+ 
+ import json
+ import sys
+ import os
+ from pathlib import Path
+ from datetime import datetime
+ from typing import Dict, List, Any, Optional
+ import hashlib
+ 
+ class LearningTracker:
+     def __init__(self):
+         self.project_root = Path.cwd()
+         self.learning_dir = self.project_root / ".claude" / "learning"
+         self.learning_dir.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+         
+         # å­¦ç¿’ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«
+         self.session_log = self.learning_dir / "session-log.jsonl"
+         self.patterns_db = self.learning_dir / "patterns.json"
+         self.improvements_db = self.learning_dir / "improvements.json"
+         self.mistakes_db = self.learning_dir / "mistakes.json"
+         
+         self.load_existing_data()
+     
+     def load_existing_data(self):
+         """æ—¢å­˜ã®å­¦ç¿’ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’èª­ã¿è¾¼ã¿"""
+         self.patterns = self.load_json_file(self.patterns_db, {
+             "tool_usage": {},
+             "file_patterns": {},
+             "success_rates": {},
+             "common_sequences": []
+         })
+         
+         self.improvements = self.load_json_file(self.improvements_db, {
+             "suggestions": [],
+             "implemented": [],
+             "rejected": []
+         })
+         
+         self.mistakes = self.load_json_file(self.mistakes_db, {
+             "error_patterns": [],
+             "prevention_rules": [],
+             "recovery_actions": []
+         })
+     
+     def load_json_file(self, file_path: Path, default: dict) -> dict:
+         """JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’å®‰å…¨ã«èª­ã¿è¾¼ã¿"""
+         try:
+             if file_path.exists():
+                 with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                     return json.load(f)
+         except Exception:
+             pass
+         return default
+     
+     def save_json_file(self, file_path: Path, data: dict):
+         """JSONãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚’å®‰å…¨ã«ä¿å­˜"""
+         try:
+             with open(file_path, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
+                 json.dump(data, f, ensure_ascii=False, indent=2)
+         except Exception as e:
+             self.log_error(f"ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä¿å­˜ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {file_path} - {e}")
+     
+     def track_tool_usage(self, tool_name: str, tool_input: dict, tool_response: dict):
+         """ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ä½¿ç”¨ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®è¿½è·¡"""
+         timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
+         
+         # ã‚»ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒ­ã‚°ã«è¨˜éŒ²
+         log_entry = {
+             "timestamp": timestamp,
+             "tool_name": tool_name,
+             "tool_input": tool_input,
+             "tool_response": tool_response,
+             "success": tool_response.get("success", True)
+         }
+         
+         self.append_to_session_log(log_entry)
+         
+         # ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ä½¿ç”¨çµ±è¨ˆæ›´æ–°
+         if tool_name not in self.patterns["tool_usage"]:
+             self.patterns["tool_usage"][tool_name] = {
+                 "count": 0,
+                 "success_count": 0,
+                 "last_used": None,
+                 "common_inputs": {}
+             }
+         
+         usage = self.patterns["tool_usage"][tool_name]
+         usage["count"] += 1
+         usage["last_used"] = timestamp
+         
+         if log_entry["success"]:
+             usage["success_count"] += 1
+         
+         # å…¥åŠ›ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®åˆ†æ
+         input_pattern = self.extract_input_pattern(tool_input)
+         if input_pattern not in usage["common_inputs"]:
+             usage["common_inputs"][input_pattern] = 0
+         usage["common_inputs"][input_pattern] += 1
+     
+     def extract_input_pattern(self, tool_input: dict) -> str:
+         """ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã‚’æŠ½å‡º"""
+         if "file_path" in tool_input:
+             file_path = tool_input["file_path"]
+             ext = Path(file_path).suffix
+             return f"file_operation_{ext}" if ext else "file_operation_no_ext"
+         elif "command" in tool_input:
+             command = tool_input["command"]
+             first_word = command.split()[0] if command.split() else "empty"
+             return f"command_{first_word}"
+         else:
+             return "other"
+     
+     def analyze_file_patterns(self, tool_input: dict):
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®åˆ†æ"""
+         if "file_path" not in tool_input:
+             return
+         
+         file_path = tool_input["file_path"]
+         path = Path(file_path)
+         
+         # ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³åˆ†æ
+         directory = str(path.parent)
+         if directory not in self.patterns["file_patterns"]:
+             self.patterns["file_patterns"][directory] = {
+                 "edit_count": 0,
+                 "file_types": {},
+                 "last_modified": None
+             }
+         
+         dir_pattern = self.patterns["file_patterns"][directory]
+         dir_pattern["edit_count"] += 1
+         dir_pattern["last_modified"] = datetime.now().isoformat()
+         
+         # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ—çµ±è¨ˆ
+         ext = path.suffix.lower()
+         if ext not in dir_pattern["file_types"]:
+             dir_pattern["file_types"][ext] = 0
+         dir_pattern["file_types"][ext] += 1
+     
+     def detect_improvement_opportunities(self, tool_name: str, tool_input: dict, tool_response: dict):
+         """æ”¹å–„æ©Ÿä¼šã®æ¤œå‡º"""
+         suggestions = []
+         
+         # é »ç¹ã«ç·¨é›†ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®ç‰¹å®š
+         if tool_name in ["Edit", "Write"] and "file_path" in tool_input:
+             file_path = tool_input["file_path"]
+             if self.is_frequently_edited_file(file_path):
+                 suggestions.append({
+                     "type": "frequent_edit",
+                     "file": file_path,
+                     "suggestion": "ã“ã®ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã¯é »ç¹ã«ç·¨é›†ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ã€‚ãƒ†ãƒ³ãƒ—ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ãƒˆåŒ–ã‚„ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«åˆ†å‰²ã‚’æ¤œè¨ã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„ã€‚"
+                 })
+         
+         # ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®æœ€é©åŒ–ææ¡ˆ
+         if tool_name == "Bash" and "command" in tool_input:
+             command = tool_input["command"]
+             optimization = self.suggest_command_optimization(command)
+             if optimization:
+                 suggestions.append(optimization)
+         
+         # æ–°ã—ã„ææ¡ˆã®ã¿è¨˜éŒ²
+         for suggestion in suggestions:
+             if not self.is_duplicate_suggestion(suggestion):
+                 self.improvements["suggestions"].append({
+                     **suggestion,
+                     "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
+                     "status": "pending"
+                 })
+     
+     def is_frequently_edited_file(self, file_path: str) -> bool:
+         """ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒé »ç¹ã«ç·¨é›†ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã‚‹ã‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"""
+         directory = str(Path(file_path).parent)
+         if directory in self.patterns["file_patterns"]:
+             return self.patterns["file_patterns"][directory]["edit_count"] > 5
+         return False
+     
+     def suggest_command_optimization(self, command: str) -> Optional[dict]:
+         """ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰ã®æœ€é©åŒ–ææ¡ˆ"""
+         # ã‚ˆãã‚ã‚‹æœ€é©åŒ–ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³
+         optimizations = {
+             "grep": "rg (ripgrep) ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨",
+             "find": "rg --files ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨",
+             "cat": "bat ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨",
+             "ls": "exa ã®ä½¿ç”¨ã‚’æ¨å¥¨"
+         }
+         
+         for old_cmd, suggestion in optimizations.items():
+             if command.startswith(old_cmd):
+                 return {
+                     "type": "command_optimization",
+                     "command": command,
+                     "suggestion": suggestion
+                 }
+         return None
+     
+     def is_duplicate_suggestion(self, new_suggestion: dict) -> bool:
+         """é‡è¤‡ã™ã‚‹ææ¡ˆã‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"""
+         for existing in self.improvements["suggestions"]:
+             if (existing.get("type") == new_suggestion.get("type") and
+                 existing.get("file") == new_suggestion.get("file") and
+                 existing.get("command") == new_suggestion.get("command")):
+                 return True
+         return False
+     
+     def detect_error_patterns(self, tool_response: dict):
+         """ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®æ¤œå‡ºãƒ»å­¦ç¿’"""
+         if not tool_response.get("success", True):
+             error_info = {
+                 "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
+                 "error_type": "tool_failure",
+                 "error_details": tool_response.get("error", "Unknown error"),
+                 "context": tool_response
+             }
+             
+             # æ–°ã—ã„ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ã¿è¨˜éŒ²
+             error_hash = self.hash_error_pattern(error_info)
+             existing_hashes = [self.hash_error_pattern(err) for err in self.mistakes["error_patterns"]]
+             
+             if error_hash not in existing_hashes:
+                 self.mistakes["error_patterns"].append(error_info)
+                 
+                 # é˜²æ­¢ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ææ¡ˆ
+                 prevention_rule = self.suggest_prevention_rule(error_info)
+                 if prevention_rule:
+                     self.mistakes["prevention_rules"].append(prevention_rule)
+     
+     def hash_error_pattern(self, error_info: dict) -> str:
+         """ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã®ãƒãƒƒã‚·ãƒ¥ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ"""
+         key_data = f"{error_info.get('error_type')}_{error_info.get('error_details', '')}"
+         return hashlib.md5(key_data.encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
+     
+     def suggest_prevention_rule(self, error_info: dict) -> Optional[dict]:
+         """ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼é˜²æ­¢ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ææ¡ˆ"""
+         error_details = error_info.get("error_details", "")
+         
+         # ä¸€èˆ¬çš„ãªã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³ã«åŸºã¥ãé˜²æ­¢ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«
+         if "permission denied" in error_details.lower():
+             return {
+                 "type": "permission_check",
+                 "rule": "ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œå‰ã«æ¨©é™ã‚’ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯",
+                 "implementation": "os.access() ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãŸäº‹å‰ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"
+             }
+         elif "file not found" in error_details.lower():
+             return {
+                 "type": "existence_check", 
+                 "rule": "ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«æ“ä½œå‰ã«å­˜åœ¨ã‚’ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯",
+                 "implementation": "Path.exists() ã‚’ä½¿ç”¨ã—ãŸäº‹å‰ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯"
+             }
+         
+         return None
+     
+     def append_to_session_log(self, log_entry: dict):
+         """ã‚»ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒ­ã‚°ã«ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒªã‚’è¿½åŠ """
+         try:
+             with open(self.session_log, "a", encoding="utf-8") as f:
+                 f.write(json.dumps(log_entry, ensure_ascii=False) + "\n")
+         except Exception as e:
+             self.log_error(f"ã‚»ãƒƒã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒ­ã‚°æ›¸ãè¾¼ã¿ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}")
+     
+     def generate_learning_report(self) -> dict:
+         """å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã®ç”Ÿæˆ"""
+         total_tools = sum(usage["count"] for usage in self.patterns["tool_usage"].values())
+         success_rate = self.calculate_overall_success_rate()
+         
+         return {
+             "timestamp": datetime.now().isoformat(),
+             "session_summary": {
+                 "total_tool_usage": total_tools,
+                 "overall_success_rate": success_rate,
+                 "unique_tools_used": len(self.patterns["tool_usage"])
+             },
+             "top_tools": self.get_top_used_tools(),
+             "improvement_opportunities": len(self.improvements["suggestions"]),
+             "error_patterns_learned": len(self.mistakes["error_patterns"]),
+             "recommendations": self.generate_recommendations()
+         }
+     
+     def calculate_overall_success_rate(self) -> float:
+         """å…¨ä½“çš„ãªæˆåŠŸç‡ã®è¨ˆç®—"""
+         total_count = sum(usage["count"] for usage in self.patterns["tool_usage"].values())
+         total_success = sum(usage["success_count"] for usage in self.patterns["tool_usage"].values())
+         
+         if total_count == 0:
+             return 0.0
+         return round(total_success / total_count * 100, 2)
+     
+     def get_top_used_tools(self, limit: int = 5) -> List[dict]:
+         """æœ€ã‚‚ä½¿ç”¨ã•ã‚ŒãŸãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ"""
+         tools = [(name, usage["count"]) for name, usage in self.patterns["tool_usage"].items()]
+         tools.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
+         
+         return [{"tool": name, "count": count} for name, count in tools[:limit]]
+     
+     def generate_recommendations(self) -> List[str]:
+         """æ”¹å–„æ¨å¥¨äº‹é …ã®ç”Ÿæˆ"""
+         recommendations = []
+         
+         # æˆåŠŸç‡ãŒä½ã„ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ã®ç‰¹å®š
+         for tool_name, usage in self.patterns["tool_usage"].items():
+             if usage["count"] > 3:  # ååˆ†ãªä½¿ç”¨å›æ•°
+                 success_rate = usage["success_count"] / usage["count"] * 100
+                 if success_rate < 80:
+                     recommendations.append(f"{tool_name} ã®æˆåŠŸç‡ãŒä½ä¸‹ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™ ({success_rate:.1f}%)")
+         
+         # é »ç¹ã«ç·¨é›†ã•ã‚Œã‚‹ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®æ¨å¥¨
+         frequent_dirs = [(dir_name, info["edit_count"]) 
+                         for dir_name, info in self.patterns["file_patterns"].items() 
+                         if info["edit_count"] > 10]
+         
+         for dir_name, count in frequent_dirs:
+             recommendations.append(f"{dir_name} ã¯é »ç¹ã«ç·¨é›†ã•ã‚Œã¦ã„ã¾ã™ ({count}å›) - æ§‹é€ è¦‹ç›´ã—ã‚’æ¤œè¨")
+         
+         return recommendations[:5]  # ä¸Šä½5ä»¶
+     
+     def save_all_data(self):
+         """ã™ã¹ã¦ã®å­¦ç¿’ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ã‚’ä¿å­˜"""
+         self.save_json_file(self.patterns_db, self.patterns)
+         self.save_json_file(self.improvements_db, self.improvements)
+         self.save_json_file(self.mistakes_db, self.mistakes)
+     
+     def log_error(self, message: str):
+         """ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ­ã‚°ã®è¨˜éŒ²"""
+         error_log = self.project_root / "logs" / "learning-tracker-errors.log"
+         error_log.parent.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
+         
+         timestamp = datetime.now().isoformat()
+         with open(error_log, "a") as f:
+             f.write(f"[{timestamp}] {message}\n")
+ 
+ def main():
+     try:
+         # æ¨™æº–å…¥åŠ›ã‹ã‚‰JSONå–å¾—
+         input_data = json.load(sys.stdin)
+         
+         tracker = LearningTracker()
+         
+         # ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«æƒ…å ±å–å¾—
+         tool_name = input_data.get("tool_name", "")
+         tool_input = input_data.get("tool_input", {})
+         tool_response = input_data.get("tool_response", {})
+         
+         if tool_name:
+             # ä½¿ç”¨ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³è¿½è·¡
+             tracker.track_tool_usage(tool_name, tool_input, tool_response)
+             
+             # ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³åˆ†æ
+             tracker.analyze_file_patterns(tool_input)
+             
+             # æ”¹å–„æ©Ÿä¼šæ¤œå‡º
+             tracker.detect_improvement_opportunities(tool_name, tool_input, tool_response)
+             
+             # ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼ãƒ‘ã‚¿ãƒ¼ãƒ³æ¤œå‡º
+             tracker.detect_error_patterns(tool_response)
+             
+             # ãƒ‡ãƒ¼ã‚¿ä¿å­˜
+             tracker.save_all_data()
+             
+             # å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆï¼ˆå®šæœŸçš„ã«ï¼‰
+             if tracker.patterns["tool_usage"] and len(tracker.patterns["tool_usage"]) % 10 == 0:
+                 report = tracker.generate_learning_report()
+                 print(f"ğŸ“Š å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆ: {report['session_summary']['total_tool_usage']} å›ã®ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«ä½¿ç”¨")
+                 
+                 if report["recommendations"]:
+                     print("ğŸ’¡ æ¨å¥¨äº‹é …:")
+                     for rec in report["recommendations"][:3]:
+                         print(f"  â€¢ {rec}")
+         
+         sys.exit(0)
+         
+     except json.JSONDecodeError as e:
+         print(f"JSONè§£æã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+     except Exception as e:
+         print(f"å­¦ç¿’ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒã‚«ãƒ¼ã‚¨ãƒ©ãƒ¼: {e}", file=sys.stderr)
+         sys.exit(1)
+ 
+ if __name__ == "__main__":
+     main() 
```

```diff
- 
+ #!/bin/bash
+ # ğŸ¯ Claude Code Rules Management System
+ # Claude Code hooks ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ã®çµ±åˆç®¡ç†ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆ
+ 
+ set -euo pipefail
+ 
+ # ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã®ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ¬ã‚¯ãƒˆãƒªã‚’å–å¾—
+ SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
+ PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"
+ HOOKS_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR/hooks"
+ LOGS_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/logs"
+ 
+ # ãƒ­ã‚°é–¢æ•°
+ log_info() {
+     echo "â„¹ï¸  $1"
+ }
+ 
+ log_success() {
+     echo "âœ… $1"
+ }
+ 
+ log_warning() {
+     echo "âš ï¸  $1"
+ }
+ 
+ log_error() {
+     echo "âŒ $1" >&2
+ }
+ 
+ # ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ çŠ¶æ…‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+ check_system_status() {
+     log_info "Claude Code Hooks ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ çŠ¶æ…‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ä¸­..."
+     
+     # å¿…é ˆãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ã®å­˜åœ¨ç¢ºèª
+     local required_files=(
+         "$SCRIPT_DIR/settings.json"
+         "$SCRIPT_DIR/rule-config.json"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/rule-enforcer.py"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/auto-formatter.py"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/command-validator.sh"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/learning-tracker.py"
+     )
+     
+     local missing_files=()
+     for file in "${required_files[@]}"; do
+         if [[ ! -f "$file" ]]; then
+             missing_files+=("$file")
+         fi
+     done
+     
+     if [[ ${#missing_files[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
+         log_error "å¿…é ˆãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒä¸è¶³ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™:"
+         printf '%s\n' "${missing_files[@]}"
+         return 1
+     fi
+     
+     # å®Ÿè¡Œæ¨©é™ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+     local executable_files=(
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/rule-enforcer.py"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/auto-formatter.py"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/command-validator.sh"
+         "$HOOKS_DIR/learning-tracker.py"
+     )
+     
+     for file in "${executable_files[@]}"; do
+         if [[ ! -x "$file" ]]; then
+             log_warning "å®Ÿè¡Œæ¨©é™ã‚’ä»˜ä¸: $file"
+             chmod +x "$file"
+         fi
+     done
+     
+     log_success "ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ çŠ¶æ…‹ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯å®Œäº†"
+     return 0
+ }
+ 
+ # è¨­å®šã®è¡¨ç¤º
+ show_config() {
+     log_info "ç¾åœ¨ã®è¨­å®š:"
+     
+     if [[ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/rule-config.json" ]]; then
+         python3 -c "
+ import json
+ with open('$SCRIPT_DIR/rule-config.json') as f:
+     config = json.load(f)
+     
+ print('ğŸ›¡ï¸  Rule Enforcer:', 'æœ‰åŠ¹' if config['rule_enforcer']['enabled'] else 'ç„¡åŠ¹')
+ print('ğŸ¨ Auto Formatter:', 'æœ‰åŠ¹' if config['auto_formatter']['enabled'] else 'ç„¡åŠ¹')  
+ print('ğŸ”’ Command Validator:', 'æœ‰åŠ¹' if config['command_validator']['enabled'] else 'ç„¡åŠ¹')
+ print('ğŸ§  Learning Tracker:', 'æœ‰åŠ¹' if config['learning_tracker']['enabled'] else 'ç„¡åŠ¹')
+ print('ğŸ“Š Development Mode:', 'æœ‰åŠ¹' if config['development_mode']['enabled'] else 'ç„¡åŠ¹')
+ "
+     else
+         log_error "è¨­å®šãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+         return 1
+     fi
+ }
+ 
+ # hooks ã®æœ‰åŠ¹åŒ–/ç„¡åŠ¹åŒ–
+ toggle_hook() {
+     local hook_name="$1"
+     local enabled="$2"
+     
+     log_info "${hook_name} ã‚’${enabled}ã«ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™..."
+     
+     python3 -c "
+ import json
+ config_file = '$SCRIPT_DIR/rule-config.json'
+ with open(config_file) as f:
+     config = json.load(f)
+ 
+ if '$hook_name' in config:
+     config['$hook_name']['enabled'] = $enabled
+     
+     with open(config_file, 'w') as f:
+         json.dump(config, f, indent=2)
+     
+     print('âœ… ${hook_name} ãŒ${enabled}ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸ')
+ else:
+     print('âŒ ${hook_name} ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“')
+     exit(1)
+ "
+ }
+ 
+ # ãƒ­ã‚°ã®è¡¨ç¤º
+ show_logs() {
+     local log_type="${1:-all}"
+     
+     log_info "ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚’è¡¨ç¤ºä¸­..."
+     
+     case "$log_type" in
+         "rule")
+             if [[ -f "$LOGS_DIR/rule-enforcement.log" ]]; then
+                 tail -20 "$LOGS_DIR/rule-enforcement.log"
+             else
+                 log_warning "ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«å¼·åˆ¶ãƒ­ã‚°ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+             fi
+             ;;
+         "format")

+                 tail -20 "$LOGS_DIR/auto-format.log"
+             else
+                 log_warning "ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ­ã‚°ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+             fi
+             ;;
+         "command")
+             if [[ -f "$LOGS_DIR/command-validation.log" ]]; then
+                 tail -20 "$LOGS_DIR/command-validation.log"
+             else
+                 log_warning "ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰æ¤œè¨¼ãƒ­ã‚°ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+             fi
+             ;;
+         "learning")
+             if [[ -f "$SCRIPT_DIR/learning/session-log.jsonl" ]]; then
+                 tail -10 "$SCRIPT_DIR/learning/session-log.jsonl" | jq -r '"\(.timestamp) \(.tool_name) - \(.success)"'
+             else
+                 log_warning "å­¦ç¿’ãƒ­ã‚°ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+             fi
+             ;;
+         "all"|*)
+             echo "=== ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«å¼·åˆ¶ãƒ­ã‚° ==="
+             show_logs "rule"
+             echo -e "\n=== ãƒ•ã‚©ãƒ¼ãƒãƒƒãƒˆãƒ­ã‚° ==="
+             show_logs "format"
+             echo -e "\n=== ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰æ¤œè¨¼ãƒ­ã‚° ==="
+             show_logs "command"
+             echo -e "\n=== å­¦ç¿’ãƒ­ã‚° ==="
+             show_logs "learning"
+             ;;
+     esac
+ }
+ 
+ # å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã®ç”Ÿæˆ
+ generate_learning_report() {
+     log_info "å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’ç”Ÿæˆä¸­..."
+     
+     if [[ -f "$HOOKS_DIR/learning-tracker.py" ]]; then

+         python3 "$HOOKS_DIR/learning-tracker.py" 2>/dev/null || \
+         log_warning "å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆç”Ÿæˆã«å¤±æ•—ã—ã¾ã—ãŸ"
+     else
+         log_error "å­¦ç¿’ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒƒã‚«ãƒ¼ãŒè¦‹ã¤ã‹ã‚Šã¾ã›ã‚“"
+     fi
+ }
+ 
+ # ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®å®Ÿè¡Œ
+ test_hooks() {
+     log_info "Hooks ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ã®ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œä¸­..."
+     
+     # ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆç”¨ã®ä¸€æ™‚ãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«ä½œæˆ

+ """
+ ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«
+ """
+ print("Hello, World!")
+ EOF
+     
+     # Rule Enforcer ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ
+     log_info "Rule Enforcer ã‚’ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆä¸­..."
+     echo '{"tool_name": "Edit", "tool_input": {"file_path": "'$test_file'", "content": "print(\"Hello\")"}}' | \
+     python3 "$HOOKS_DIR/rule-enforcer.py" && \
+     log_success "Rule Enforcer ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šé" || \

+

+     log_success "Auto Formatter ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šé" || \
+     log_warning "Auto Formatter ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆå¤±æ•—"
+     
+     # Command Validator ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ
+     log_info "Command Validator ã‚’ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆä¸­..."
+     echo '{"tool_name": "Bash", "tool_input": {"command": "echo test"}}' | \

+     log_success "Command Validator ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šé" || \
+     log_warning "Command Validator ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆå¤±æ•—"
+     
+     # Learning Tracker ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ
+     log_info "Learning Tracker ã‚’ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆä¸­..."
+     echo '{"tool_name": "Edit", "tool_input": {"file_path": "'$test_file'"}, "tool_response": {"success": true}}' | \
+     python3 "$HOOKS_DIR/learning-tracker.py" && \
+     log_success "Learning Tracker ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆé€šé" || \
+     log_warning "Learning Tracker ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆå¤±æ•—"
+     
+     # ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒ•ã‚¡ã‚¤ãƒ«å‰Šé™¤
+     rm -f "$test_file"
+     
+     log_success "Hooks ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆå®Œäº†"
+ }
+ 
+ # é–‹ç™ºãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã®åˆ‡ã‚Šæ›¿ãˆ
+ toggle_dev_mode() {
+     local enabled="$1"
+     
+     log_info "é–‹ç™ºãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’${enabled}ã«ã—ã¦ã„ã¾ã™..."
+     
+     python3 -c "
+ import json

+     config = json.load(f)

+ 
+ # é–‹ç™ºãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰æ™‚ã®è¨­å®šèª¿æ•´

+     config['rule_enforcer']['strictness_level'] = 'low'

+     config['development_mode']['verbose_logging'] = True

+     config['command_validator']['security_level'] = 'high'
+     config['development_mode']['reduced_restrictions'] = False

+     json.dump(config, f, indent=2)
+ 
+ print('âœ… é–‹ç™ºãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ãŒ${enabled}ã«ãªã‚Šã¾ã—ãŸ')
+ "
+ }
+ 
+ # ãƒ˜ãƒ«ãƒ—ã®è¡¨ç¤º
+ show_help() {
+     cat << 'EOF'
+ ğŸ¯ Claude Code Rules Management System
+ 
+ ä½¿ç”¨æ–¹æ³•:
+   ./claude-rules.sh <command> [options]
+ 
+ ã‚³ãƒãƒ³ãƒ‰:
+   status                 ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ çŠ¶æ…‹ã‚’ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+   config                 ç¾åœ¨ã®è¨­å®šã‚’è¡¨ç¤º
+   
+   enable <hook>          æŒ‡å®šã•ã‚ŒãŸhookã‚’æœ‰åŠ¹åŒ–
+   disable <hook>         æŒ‡å®šã•ã‚ŒãŸhookã‚’ç„¡åŠ¹åŒ–
+   
+   logs [type]            ãƒ­ã‚°ã‚’è¡¨ç¤º (type: rule, format, command, learning, all)
+   report                 å­¦ç¿’ãƒ¬ãƒãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’ç”Ÿæˆ

+   test                   Hooks ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ ã‚’ãƒ†ã‚¹ãƒˆ

+   dev-off                é–‹ç™ºãƒ¢ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚’ç„¡åŠ¹åŒ–

+   help                   ã“ã®ãƒ˜ãƒ«ãƒ—ã‚’è¡¨ç¤º
+ 
+ Hookå:
+   rule_enforcer          ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«å¼·åˆ¶ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ

+   ./claude-rules.sh test
+ EOF
+ }
+ 
+ # ãƒ¡ã‚¤ãƒ³å‡¦ç†
+ main() {
+     local command="${1:-help}"
+     
+     case "$command" in
+         "status")
+             check_system_status
+             ;;
+         "config")
+             show_config
+             ;;
+         "enable")

+                 log_error "Hookåã‚’æŒ‡å®šã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„"
+                 exit 1
+             fi
+             toggle_hook "$2" "true"
+             ;;

+                 log_error "Hookåã‚’æŒ‡å®šã—ã¦ãã ã•ã„"
+                 exit 1
+             fi

+             ;;
+         "report")

+             ;;
+         "test")

+             ;;
+         "dev-on")
+             toggle_dev_mode "true"
+             ;;
+         "dev-off")
+             toggle_dev_mode "false"
+             ;;
+         "help"|*)
+             show_help
+             ;;
+     esac
+ }
+ 
+ # å®Ÿè¡Œ
+ main "$@"

```diff

+ 
+ Claude Code ã® hooks æ©Ÿèƒ½ã‚’æ´»ç”¨ã—ãŸ**å‹•çš„ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«åˆ¶å¾¡ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ **ã§ã™ã€‚

+ ## ğŸš€ ã‚·ã‚¹ãƒ†ãƒ æ¦‚è¦
+ 
+ Claude Code ã® hooks ã¯ã€ãƒ„ãƒ¼ãƒ«å®Ÿè¡Œå‰å¾Œã«å‹•çš„ã«ã‚¹ã‚¯ãƒªãƒ—ãƒˆã‚’å®Ÿè¡Œã§ãã‚‹å¼·åŠ›ãªæ©Ÿèƒ½ã§ã™ã€‚ã“ã‚Œã«ã‚ˆã‚Šã€å¾“æ¥ã® cursor-rules ã§ã¯ä¸å¯èƒ½ã ã£ãŸ**ãƒªã‚¢ãƒ«ã‚¿ã‚¤ãƒ ã§ã®ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒ«åˆ¶å¾¡**ãŒå®Ÿç¾ã•ã‚Œã¾ã™ã€‚
+ 
+ ### ğŸ”¥ ä¸»è¦ãªé©æ–°ç‚¹
+
